title: How to burn videos from my computer to a DVD - Quora

response.answer_text: Cast the video to ISO format. This is the standard format used to burn DVDs. Search for convert mp4 to ISO and some converters will show up. (Handbreak is one.)Burn the DVD. Insert a blank in your DVD burner, then burn it.For example, from a web search:* Click the Windows "Start" button and click "All Programs." ... Click the "Burn a CD or DVD" button that displays when the Media Player software detects the blank DVD-R.* Select "Video DVD" from the list of burning options. ...* Click "Video Library" to choose a video from your list of movies.
you will find a point on the File Explorer that will burn the files that you have on your window. it’s built-in but not obvious. you can grab a burner from any number of free-software- sites.
